intro: Distimake lobulibracteatus, commonly known as the featherleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, feather-like leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. Distimake lobulibracteatus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions.
